title: Boeing 737 Hydraulic System Inspection Procedure
description: This procedure provides detailed steps for inspecting the hydraulic system on Boeing 737 aircraft.
safety_precautions: Follow all safety protocols in the maintenance manual
Relieve hydraulic pressure before inspecting components

steps.title: Preparation
steps.description: Ensure aircraft is in a safe state for maintenance. Verify hydraulic system is depressurized.
notes: Refer to AMM Chapter 29-00-00 for safety precautions
steps.verification: Confirm hydraulic pressure gauges read zero

steps.title: Access Panel Removal
steps.description: Remove access panels to gain access to hydraulic system components.
notes: Refer to AMM Chapter 29-10-00 for panel locations
steps.verification: All required access panels removed and secured

steps.title: Hydraulic Reservoir Inspection
steps.description: Inspect hydraulic reservoirs for proper fluid level, leaks, and contamination.
notes: Fluid level should be between MIN and MAX marks when system is unpressurized
steps.verification: Fluid level within limits, no leaks or contamination observed

steps.title: Hydraulic Pump Inspection
steps.description: Inspect hydraulic pumps for leaks, proper mounting, and condition of drive couplings.
cautions: Do not attempt to rotate pumps manually
notes: Check for evidence of overheating or unusual wear
steps.verification: Pumps properly mounted, no leaks or damage observed

steps.title: Hydraulic Lines and Fittings Inspection
steps.description: Inspect hydraulic lines and fittings for leaks, chafing, proper routing, and security.
cautions: Do not apply excessive force to fittings
notes: Pay special attention to areas where lines pass near moving components
steps.verification: All lines properly routed and secured, no leaks or chafing observed

steps.title: Hydraulic Actuator Inspection
steps.description: Inspect hydraulic actuators for leaks, proper mounting, and condition of rod ends.
cautions: Do not attempt to move flight control surfaces manually
notes: Check for evidence of fluid leakage around seals
steps.verification: Actuators properly mounted, no leaks or damage observed

steps.title: Hydraulic Filter Inspection
steps.description: Inspect hydraulic filters for proper installation and check filter differential pressure indicators.
cautions: Do not remove filter elements unless replacement is planned
notes: Red indicators show filter needs replacement
steps.verification: Filters properly installed, no differential pressure indicators showing

steps.title: Hydraulic Fluid Sampling
steps.description: Take hydraulic fluid samples for contamination analysis if required by maintenance schedule.
notes: Follow laboratory procedures for sample handling
steps.verification: Samples taken according to maintenance schedule requirements

steps.title: Access Panel Reinstallation
steps.description: Reinstall all access panels and secure with proper fasteners.
cautions: Ensure all tools are accounted for before closing panels
notes: Refer to AMM Chapter 29-10-00 for fastener torque values
steps.verification: All panels reinstalled and secured properly

steps.title: Documentation
cautions: Ensure all work is properly documented
notes: Include any discrepancies found during inspection

post_procedure_checks: Verify all access panels are properly secured
Ensure all tools and equipment are accounted for
Verify maintenance records are properly completed
